sense.name: put the foot down (on something); walk
sense.examples: Tread softly and carry a big stick. Don't tread on me! Turning around, he treaded softly past Gabriel's room. He treaded on the prudent path of empirically validating economic theories. All those countries treaded the path of the Malaysian government. We treaded the grapes until they turned into a paste.

sense.name: apply a tread to
sense.examples: He treaded all the refurbished tires.

sense.name: mate with
sense.examples: The male bird tread the female.

sense.name: TREAD WATER: keep one's head above water
sense.examples: The soldiers treaded water for almost 24 hours before being rescued. It's very important to teach your child to tread water. If you don't have a life vest, it's useful to know how to tread water.
